page.title: 01THE FENS OF CAMBRIDGESHIRE
page.content: THE AREA SURVEYED BY THE PUPILS OF { {COATES COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL}IS IN A PART OF THE COUNTY OF CAMBRIDGESHIRE KNOWN AS THE{BLACK FENS}WHICH IS ALMOST ENTIRELY BELOW SEA LEVEL.IT IS AN EMPTY LANDSCAPE,FLAT AND TREELESS, DOMINATED BY THE SEEMINGLY VAST SKY. THE BLACK SOIL IS COMPOSED ALMOST ENTIRELY OF PEAT, AND MAKES THIS AN EXCELLENT AREA TO GROW ARABLE CROPS SUCH AS CEREALS, ROOT CROPS AND SUGAR BEET.THE FIELDS ARE LARGE, FLAT AND CRISS CROSSED BY DRAINAGE DITCHES AND DYKES LIKE THE POLDER LANDS OF HOLLAND. A NETWORK OF ELECTRIC PUMPS ENSURES THE LAND IS NOT FLOODED. UNDERLYING THE PEAT IS A THICK LAYER OF CLAY WHICH IS USED IN THE OTHER MAJOR INDUSTRY OF THE AREA - BRICK MAKING.
